image.altText: epkd_PoliceVideo_1808

items.synopsis: The national children's commissioner is calling for an NT Police promotional video of officers chasing and arresting two teenagers to be taken down.

title.children: 'Potentially dangerous': Children's commissioner slams NT Police promotional video

image.altText: Nathan Finn (1)

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory Police Association's new president has used his first public speech to slam successive NT government policies and "rushed and bungled" rollouts he says are failing frontline officers.

title.children: NT police union president uses first public speech to highlight 'crisis' within force

image.altText: Aerial view of the Jabiru town centre.

items.synopsis: NT police have found two 15-year-old students who went missing from a school camp in Kakadu National Park on Thursday night.

title.children: Police find students missing from Kakadu National Park school camp

image.altText: A little animal steps out of a green bag laid on the ground, with a hand guiding it out.

items.synopsis: Golden bandicoots were last sighted in this area in 1967. Now a translocation project is aiming to revive the marsupial's population.

title.children: This little creature was locally extinct last week. Now, they're back — and growing

image.altText: A group of friends, mostly men wearing board shorts and no shirts, gather together in front of a beach hut

items.synopsis: When two boats set off towards an Indonesian island for a birthday surfing trip, none of those on board could have predicted the next few days. Here's how the survivors managed more than 36 hours at sea.

title.children: How a split-second decision off the island of Aceh may have saved four Australians

image.altText: Alisha Fagan appears serious as she stands outside a court building in Melbourne.

items.synopsis: Alisha Fagan, who caused the death of 69-year-old grandfather Sedat Hassan in a 2022 crash, will be eligible for parole in less than six months.

title.children: Melbourne driver who killed grandfather then blamed crash on 'African men' jailed

image.altText: A police boat turns in a boat pen

items.synopsis: A man is dead following a serious boating mishap off the coast north of Perth, after an upturned vessel was spotted offshore.

title.children: One person dead, two rescued after boating accident off Perth coast

image.altText: A young Indigenous woman smiling out the front of a home

items.synopsis: Indigenous mother-of-four Charlotte Dodds was working as a disability support worker when she started to feel unwell. At age 30, she didn't recognise the stroke symptoms.

title.children: Charlotte had a stroke at age 30. As an Indigenous woman, a study has found she's far from alone

image.altText: Rear shot of a woman in a purple coat holding a grey mug

items.synopsis: More than 170,000 people across Australia are on the housing waitlist, including people like Annabelle, who faces living out of a car with her cat in a few weeks.

title.children: Annabelle is uni-educated and has an impressive corporate background. She's also homeless — at the age of 54

image.altText: A woman looks into the camera and smiles slightly.

items.synopsis: It's legal for one law firm to represent both sides of a real estate transaction but legal experts warn it can make navigating conflict difficult.

title.children: When Christine sold her home, the buyer used the same law firm. Things soon became 'very sticky'

image.altText: A soccer player wearing yellow and green sits on her haunches after a game

items.synopsis: Mystery surrounded Alanna Kennedy's late withdrawal from Australia's clash with England, but the Matildas have since confirmed the defender has delayed concussion symptoms.

title.children: Matildas defender Alanna Kennedy to miss Sweden match as reason for semifinal absence is confirmed

image.altText: A woman holding soccer balls and smiling in yellow shirt and black puffy jacket.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has told the Australian public to "watch this space" when it comes to more funding for women's sport in the wake of the Matildas' World Cup successes, after the opposition pledged $250 million.

title.children: The opposition promised to fund women's sport after the Matildas' success, but sports rorts cast a shadow

image.altText: John Devitt

items.synopsis: Australian swimming is mourning the death of Olympic gold medallist John Devitt, who broke 14 world records across his 13-year swimming career.

title.children: Aussie swimmer who broke 14 world records and won two Olympic gold medals dies aged 86

image.altText: A selfie of a young man wearing a hat

items.synopsis: Police say a man and a woman were inside RQ's Tavern at Robina for about 90 seconds before a 26-year-old man was allegedly stabbed in the chest.

title.children: Man, 26, allegedly killed within 90 seconds of couple entering Gold Coast pub, police say

image.altText: A man sits in a chair with a purple tie while talking to another man.

items.synopsis: The veteran UK broadcaster was often asked to reflect on his fulfilling career.

title.children: Veteran UK broadcaster Michael Parkinson enjoyed every minute of work he had

image.altText: Two EPA workers test water by the Nungar River

items.synopsis: The  EPA fines a contractor over the release of 9,000 litres of sediment-laden water in Kosciuszko National Park.

title.children: Snowy 2.0 contractor fined over alleged pollution for third time

image.altText: A young man with short, dark hair, wearing a white shirt, outside court.

items.synopsis: Star St George Illawarra player Junior Amone has been accused of chasing a tradesman across a roof with a hammer but is arguing a case of mistaken identity.

title.children: NRL star not present at time of alleged hammer attack, defence argues

image.altText: A coat of arms and sign saying 'Local Court' on a column outside a courthouse.

items.synopsis: Neil Marika’s violence towards his partner Miss Yunupiŋu had escalated to a point where he assaulted her "in front of members of the community", the inquest into her death has heard.

title.children: Killer had assaulted partner in public, but community felt 'helpless', coroner hears

image.altText: Man in jeans and blue shirt holds a teenage boy on the ground, his face blurred.

items.synopsis: The arrest of the 18-year-old Indigenous man was videoed and shared on social media, which the NSW police minister said was "difficult to watch".

title.children: Police officer on restricted duties as arrest of 18-year-old man in Taree under investigation

image.altText: planes on an airport runway

items.synopsis: WA Police allege the man became verbally aggressive after being declined alcohol, before he got out of his seat and assaulted a female crew member.

title.children: Perth man charged over alleged assault of Qantas crew member

image.altText: Outside of the Berri Magistrates Court, the sky is blue and the sign is dark brown.

items.synopsis: A regional South Australian general practitioner alleged to have forged more than 40 prescriptions for opioid medications for personal use faces up to five years in prison.

title.children: GP allegedly uses other doctor's computers for more than 40 opioid prescriptions

image.altText: Mitchell Walsh serial drink driver WA

items.synopsis: Mitchell Walsh who was involved in the death of schoolgirl Jess Meehan two decades ago is being extradited to Perth after he allegedly skipped bail on fresh drink driving-related charges.

title.children: Serial drink driver who killed 10yo girl extradited from Sydney to face fresh driving charges

image.altText: A group of penguins huddling at the edge of a blue ocean.

items.synopsis: Wildlife rescuers believe seals are behind the unusual deaths of birds washed up on beaches near Batemans Bay and Currarong, and say it is possible they learnt the behaviour from seals off South Africa.

title.children: Seals in a 'frenzy-kill' most likely culprits as beheaded penguins and dead gannets wash up on NSW beaches

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a polo shirt with the Maui emergency service agency logo speaks at a press conference

items.synopsis: The resignation comes a day after he said he had no regret about not using sirens to warn residents of wildfires that devastated the historic seaside community of Lahaina and killed at least 111 people.

title.children: Maui's emergency services chief resigns after criticism for not activating alarms

image.altText: Naotunne Vijitha Nayaka Thero sits on a couch wearing a crimson robe.

items.synopsis: The Venerable Naotunne Vijitha Nayaka Thero, who is the abbot of the Dhamma Sarana temple in Melbourne's south-east, is facing 13 charges including sexual penetration of a child under 16 and indecent act with a child under 16.

title.children: Buddhist monk at Melbourne temple faces court on child sex abuse charges

image.altText: red and yellow hazard tape in front of driveway

items.synopsis: Emergency services seized over 50 vials of hazardous materials, which Fire and Rescue NSW (FRNSW) said on Thursday was believed to be low-level radioactive isotopes, from an Arncliffe property on Thursday.

title.children: 'Radioactive isotopes' found in Sydney home did not threaten national security, Australian Border Force says

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

items.synopsis: Abhishek Timalsina admitted to having sex with the woman in a Westfield Belconnen art store in November 2022, but argued it was a consensual interaction because "her expression, her face and her body language" showed she was "willing".

title.children: Jury fails to reach verdict in trial of Canberra retail worker accused of raping customer

image.altText: Two bees poke their heads into a golden hive, while another rubs it's front legs together on the outside of the hive.

items.synopsis: American foulbrood — a disease deadly to bees — is detected during routine honey testing by a commercial beekeeper in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Bee disease with potential to wipe out whole colonies found in Top End honey

image.altText: A man pointing a weapon.

items.synopsis: Barry Vassella's anxiety emerged with the sudden force of a gunshot, overwhelmed by a memory he could not yet decipher, and sparked simply by a log on the ground at a golf course.

title.children: Our Vietnam War was more than the hundreds killed. The aftermath was confronting for the 60,000 who served

image.altText: A Holden ute lifted into the air by a crane

items.synopsis: The Holden ute, worth an estimated $20,000, was reduced to scrap metal by police today, about six months after it was clocked at "one of the highest ever speeds" detected on South Australian roads.

title.children: Holden ute previously clocked at 253kph on Adelaide motorway crushed by police
